byline.original: By ELIZABETH A. HARRIS and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Russell Midori, John Schwartz and Iman Stevenson contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials said that 140 buildings so far had shown elevated levels, but that the vast majority of those sites already have safeguards in place.

headline.print_headline: Testing Shows Lead Persists in New York’s Schools
headline.main: Tests Show Lead Persists in Some New York City Schools

snippet: Officials said that 140 buildings so far had shown elevated levels, but that the vast majority of those sites already have safeguards in place.
abstract: Retesting of water in New York City's public schools for lead reveals 140 schools with at least one sample showing elevated levels so far; city officials say they have tested and received results from about a third of 1,500 buildings in city, and emphasize that majority of schools already have protocols in place to safeguard students and staff.
